H0.text: Odor receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

H1.text: Matter receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

H2.text: Consumption receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

H3.text: Optic receptors line the passages of the nose and sense chemicals in the air.

A4.text: Olfactory receptors (ORs), also known as odorant receptors, are chemoreceptors expressed in the cell membranes of olfactory receptor neurons and are responsible for the detection of odorants (for example, compounds that have an odor) which give rise to the sense of smell.

A5.text: In vertebrates, the olfactory receptors are located in both the cilia and synapses of the olfactory sensory neurons and in the epithelium of the human airway.
